comments.html:
I first got into networking around 1999, the LAN I was working on at the time was built around LANE and 3COM CoreBuilders. It sure colours your understanding of how a LAN really works ;)

Sean
comments.name: Sean

comments.html: I think it was Kalapana, they we some kind of pioneers in the switching area if I recall well. The 3000 and LANE was not so bad, it was expensive though and LANE was difficult to configure.
comments.name: Arturo Servin

comments.html: It was ok as long as you don't stack the Catalyst 3000s using the special cables :-) It was not an IOS CLI switch by the way; it was menu-driven like 3COM.
comments.name: William Chu

comments.html:
I worked for Madge in the nineties - the pay off line was "Switching to ATM"
This strategy largely led to Madge's downfall which was at that stage the fifth largest network company in the world.
I do think that some of the service assurance features available in ATM have not yet been implemented to this day in the alternative technologies.
comments.name: Ronald Bartels
